column1: Akşehir is a town and district of Konya Province in the Central Anatolia region of Turkey. According to 2000 census
column4: 000 live in the town of Akşehir. The town was known in the Roman and Byzantine empires as Philomelium or Philomelion (Greek: Φιλομήλιον) respectively.

column1: The town is situated at the edge of a fertile plain
column2: on the north side of the Sultan Dagh.

column1: Philomelion was probably a Pergamene foundation on the great Graeco-Roman Highway from Ephesus to the east
column2: and to its townsmen the Smyrniotes wrote the letter that describes the martyrdom of Polycarp. Cicero
column4: dated some of his extant correspondence there; and the place played a considerable part in the frontier wars between the Byzantine emperors and the Sultanate of Rum. It became an important Seljuk town
column5: and late in the 14th century passed into Ottoman hands. There Bayezit I of the Ottoman Empire is said by Ali of Yezd to have died after his defeat at the Battle of Ankara.
